title: Almond Weights
question_text:
The quality control inspector at an almond packaging plant checks the packaging equipment by randomly selecting and weighing $25\text{ bags}$ each day. The packaging equipment is calibrated to package bags with a mean weight of $12\text{ ounces}$ and a standard deviation of $0.25\text{ ounces}$.
What should be the mean and standard deviation for the sampling distribution of all the daily mean weights?

Explanation of Distractors

Choices 'A' and 'B' are incorrect. The mean of the sampling distribution would be 300 ounces
if the problem asked for the sampling distribution of the total weight of the sample bags each day.

Choices 'C' and 'E' are incorrect. Some students use the sample size in the denominator instead of the square root of the sample size. That mistake leads to an incorrect standard deviation of 0.01
